definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.chinese: 他在18洞的高爾夫賽程中得了85杆的成績。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, we cannot send other Test Report forms to you directly.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們不能將額外的成績單直接寄給您本人。

sentences.english: If the results are not for the current year, please indicate that the year of the entry.
sentences.chinese: 如非本年度所考獲之成績，請註明應考年份。

sentences.english: What happens if a candidate loses their Test Report Form?
sentences.chinese: 如果考生的成績單丟失怎麼辦？

sentences.english: I was level with my friend in the examination；we got the same number of marks.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的朋友考試成績一樣，我們所得分數相同。

sentences.english: The Commission or training institution may give reward to those who are outstanding in performance.
sentences.chinese: 成績特優者，由本會或訓練機構給予獎勵。

sentences.english: Now you are in a tie, you shall have one more jump at the height.
sentences.chinese: 你們成績相等，每人在這個高度再試跳一次。

sentences.english: So, in effect, the act of degree classification trivialises the student's achievement.
sentences.chinese: 因此，學位分級制度實際上輕視了學生的學習成績。

sentences.english: My english performance is better than one day by one day since I joined HJ English.
sentences.chinese: 自從加入廬江之後，我的英語成績一天比一天好。

sentences.english: I had done a better job in the final examination!
sentences.chinese: 我多麼希望在期末考試時考出好成績。

sentences.english: Results sometimes you study the performance of the test.
sentences.chinese: 成績有時候是對你學習的好壞的檢驗。

sentences.english: Participated in the Collge English Test Band Four and Six, and achieved excellent scores.
sentences.chinese: 參加英語四六級考試，並取得優異成績。

sentences.english: Lin’s grades are “so-so,” he said, and he dropped one class.
sentences.chinese: 林說自己的成績平平，他還退選了一個課程。

sentences.english: In the final exams, his average grade was above 90 points.
sentences.chinese: 他在期終考試中，科第成績平均都在90分。

sentences.english: After United Arab Republic three, gave 12 point 4 backboard report card, displayed not vulgarly .
sentences.chinese: 阿聯三節後繳出了12分4籃板的成績單，表現不俗。

definition: to show/to show off/to display/to manifest/expression/manifestation/show/display/performance (at work etc)/behavior
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
